issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h5.Description
Icons are not being copied to the correct location when a project is built.
Icons are being copied to "Apps/" when the should be in "images/"
I have attached a project with a few crude images and their expected file names and sizes.

Windows will ignore any images you have saved in the "Apps/" folder and displays the windows default app-icon, and the only way to correct the icons is to manually copy the icons into the correct location and then build and deploy the project using the generated visual studio solution file.

+Extra Information+
The following link is the official windows documentation for file names and icon sizes: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/hh846296.aspx
fields.summary: Windows Hybrid: Icons not copied to correct location when project is built
fields.environment:
Windows 8.1
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.2.1.201402061120
Titanium SDK, build: 3.2.1.v20140206172952 (Windows Hybrid)
CLI: 3.2.1

comments.body:
Verified fixed on:
Windows 8.1
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.3.0.201405121247
Titanium SDK, build: 3.3.0.v20140512162513
Titanium CLI, build: 3.3.0-dev
Nokia Lumia 520: 8.0

Icons copied into the correct location.
Icons work when built to device.
Closing.
